title: 113_hr2617
content: The Act may be cited as the "Apollo Lunar Landing Legacy Act." Congress acknowledges the historic Apollo lunar missions, including the first moon landing in 1969 and subsequent missions, highlighting the importance of protecting the lunar landing sites for future generations by establishing a Historical Park under the Apollo Lunar Landing Legacy Act. The Apollo Lunar Landing Legacy Act aims to expand protection and preservation of the Apollo lunar landing sites for greater recognition and public understanding of this historic achievement in American history. The purposes of the Act are to preserve historically significant sites, protect artifacts for scientific inquiry, and enhance public understanding of the Apollo program and its legacy through preservation of resources. SEC. 4. DEFINITIONS. The Administrator refers to the head of NASA, Apollo lunar landing sites are areas where Apollo missions landed on the Moon, Historical Park is the Apollo Lunar Landing Sites National Historical Park, and the Secretary is the head of the Interior Department. Establishment of the Apollo Lunar Landing Sites National Historical Park within 1 year of the Act's enactment. The park will include artifacts from Apollo 11, Apollo 12, and Apollo 13 missions on the Moon's surface. The artifacts on the Moon's surface from Apollo 14, 15, 16, and 17 missions are associated with specific landing dates and locations. SEC. 6. ADMINISTRATION. The Secretary administers the Historical Park in accordance with applicable laws and international treaties. A general management plan must be completed within 18 months. The Secretary may enter agreements with other federal agencies for donations and cooperative efforts. The Secretary may enter agreements with federal agencies to provide public access to historically significant Apollo lunar landing site resources. They can also accept donations and enter into cooperative agreements with foreign entities to further the purpose of the interagency agreement. Additionally, the Administrator of NASA may accept gifts, bequests, and devises for the purposes of the Act. SEC. 7. MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT. The Secretary and the Administrator will enter into an agreement for the primary management of the Historical Park, outlining their respective duties. The Administrator will be responsible for monitoring the Apollo lunar landing sites, managing access to the sites, and cataloguing items in the park with the Smithsonian Institution. They will also consult with other agencies as needed. To effectively manage the Historical Park, the Administrator will consult with other agencies as needed. SEC. 8. The Secretary will submit the Apollo 11 lunar landing site to UNESCO for World Heritage Site designation within a year of the Historical Park's establishment. SEC. 9. Existing agreements between NASA and the Smithsonian Institution regarding the management of historical artifacts will not be affected by this Act.
